intro: Scirpus planiculmis, commonly known as the flat-leaf bulrush, is a perennial aquatic plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features tall, slender stems covered with narrow, flat leaves that are often green to reddish in color. Its flowering spikes produce small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown, adapting to wet environments. Scirpus planiculmis plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
